title: Fireball Flashes Above Ontario and Parts of the U.S.
description: The bright meteor was the sixth object detected in space before striking Earth, the European Space Agency said.

title: Red Sea Coral Reefs Keep Thriving Despite Global Warming
description: As warming waters devastate coral around the world, the sea’s stunningly colorful reefs have been remarkably resilient. But pollution, mass tourism and overfishing put them at risk.

title: U.N. Talks Reach Decisive Moment on Fight Over Climate Justice
description: Disputes among nations centered on a fund to help developing countries cope with “loss and damage” caused by global warming.

title: As the War Rages, Ukraine Wages a Daunting Battle to Rebuild
description: Fully 61,000 square miles could be littered with land mines and other explosives left by retreating Russian forces, while half the electric grid has been destroyed.

title: World Cup in Qatar Caps Big Gulf Push Into International Sports
description: In hosting major international sporting events, buying up soccer teams and even creating a golf league, the resource-rich Gulf States are seeking attention, prestige, economic diversification and political credibility.

title: 1st Train in 9 Months Leaves Kyiv for Kherson
description: The train, carrying 200 passengers, is to be the start of regular service between the cities, a senior official said.

title: In Yahidne, Ukraine, a Battered School Holds Memories of Trauma
description: In Yahidne, a village in northern Ukraine, a basement became a virtual prison for hundreds of residents for four weeks. Months later, that horror lingers.

title: 1st Train in 9 Months Leaves Kyiv for Kherson
description: The train, carrying 200 passengers, is to be the start of regular service between the cities, a senior official said.

title: Pie, Made Easy
description: Stressed about a homemade Thanksgiving pie? Don’t be. My tips will help.

title: Did Billions in Spending Make a Dent in Homelessness? Canada Doesn’t Know.
description: An auditor general’s report found that multibillion-dollar federal housing programs were not being tracked to see whether they actually reduced homelessness.

title: With nearly half of Ukraine’s energy grid knocked out, Zelensky says 17 regions face a ‘difficult situation.’
Security Forces in Iran Have Blinded Hundreds of Protesters
description: Security forces have been firing ammunition that has ruptured the eyes of antigovernment demonstrators in the past two months. “Everything went dark,” one said.

title: Gang Violence Cripples Haiti’s Fight Against Cholera
description: The disease is spreading in the Caribbean nation in part because armed groups control poor neighborhoods with ruthless violence and prevent doctors from providing basic care.

title: Ukraine’s Reclaimed City of Kherson Is Reconnected to Kyiv by Rail
description: The first train since before Russia’s invasion left the capital, Kyiv, for the strategically important southern city.

title: Kim Jong-un Takes His Daughter to Missile Test Launch
description: Little is known about North Korea’s ruling family. Yesterday was the first public appearance of the child, who is thought to be named Ju-ae.

title: Corrections: Nov. 19, 2022
description: Corrections that appeared in print on Saturday, Nov. 19, 2022.

title: North Korea’s Arsenal, Nuclear and Otherwise, Has Grown Fast
description: Kim Jong-un has sought to solidify the country’s stance as a nuclear-armed power, and his position at its helm.

title: Iranian Protesters Attack Khomeini’s Childhood Home as Unrest Spreads
description: The house where the Islamic revolution’s founder grew up was set on fire during a fresh surge of anger over the government’s killing of children, including three in the city of Izeh.

title: Russia Raises Hopes for Griner’s Release, but U.S. Says It’s Just Talk
description: The State Department says Russia refuses to negotiate seriously to free the basketball star Brittney Griner, who was sent to a penal colony with a nine-year sentence on a cannabis charge.
